abstract: <jats:p> This study examined 286 stories posted about the Black Lives Matter movement and protests following George Floyd’s death by the six most-viewed U.S. news outlets on Facebook during summer 2020. These organizations published a significant amount of content, though the frequency declined throughout the summer. Stories mostly framed protesters positively and police negatively. Organizations regularly used law/crime spot news to frame protests. The findings may signal a potential shift away from the media’s protest paradigm. </jats:p>
title: Black Lives Matter to media (finally): A content analysis of news coverage during summer 2020

affiliation.name: Cox is a professor at Salisbury University
